title: Drawing, "Design for a Cruet Stand", 1936
medium: Pen and ink, white pastel, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Watermark: ANCNNES MANUFRES CANSON & MONTGOLFIER -- VIDALON - LES - ANNDNAY
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, center right: COUPER LE PIED DES/PIECES DE MANIERE A CE/QUE LA PARTIE BOULE/REPOSE SUR LE FONS DU/PLATEAU.; lower right: J.P./36/2x1; below handle: CHARNIERE; lower left: "NIVEAU DU FONDS;" right: ENCASTREMENT DES PIECES; in yellow ink, lower right: ANSE CLISSE; in blue color pencil on verso: aboutonier (?).
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Rectangular cruet stand fitted with two spherical containers, each with pointed spout and C-scroll handles drawn in yellow ink to be executed in wicker. The stand with four hinged arms and central cylindrical handle. Arms can be lowered into tray when not in use. Underdrawing in graphite of cruet stand in golden section.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Cruet Stand", 1936.
1936. Pen and ink, white pastel, graphite on cream tracing paper. Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra. 1995-164-23.
